title: 104_hr2748
content: The Act titled "Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act of 1995" prohibits health insurance discrimination based on genetic information. The Act prohibits health insurance discrimination based on genetic information, including denial or cancellation of coverage, variation of premiums, and disclosure of genetic information without prior authorization. The Act prohibits health insurance discrimination based on genetic information and requires prior written authorization for disclosure of genetic information. Enforcement is carried out by the State insurance commissioner for plans other than employee health benefit plans, while the Secretary enforces requirements for employee health benefit plans. The Secretary enforces requirements for employee health benefit plans in a similar manner as specified in the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. A person has the right to bring a civil action to address violations and obtain relief, including monetary damages. State courts and district courts of the United States have jurisdiction over such matters. The district courts of the United States have jurisdiction over actions under this subsection, regardless of the amount in controversy or the parties' citizenship. Venue provisions of section 1391 of title 28, United States Code, apply. The Secretary may issue regulations to implement this section. States can enforce more restrictive requirements for insurance providers or health insurance coverage related to this section. The district courts have jurisdiction over actions under this subsection, regardless of the amount in controversy or the parties' citizenship. Venue provisions apply. The Secretary may issue regulations. States can enforce more restrictive requirements for insurance providers or health insurance coverage. This section does not affect section 514 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. It also does not require a group health plan to provide benefits to a particular participant or beneficiary. Definitions for employee health benefit plan are provided. The Income Security Act of 1974 provides health insurance coverage directly, through a group health plan, or otherwise. Definitions include "family member" as a blood relative, "genetic information" as inherited characteristics, and "genetic services" for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes. A group health plan, as defined in the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, includes multiple employer welfare arrangements providing health insurance coverage. Health insurance coverage encompasses various contractual arrangements for healthcare payments, such as group health plans and other insurance arrangements like hospital or medical expense policies. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms such as individual health plan, insurance provider, person, Secretary, and State. These definitions are important for understanding the regulations outlined in the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. Section 508 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include the Genetic Insurance Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act of 1995. This amendment applies to health insurance coverage offered or renewed 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
